post_text: Good afternoon students, parents and guardians of HCUSD#3. With the release of the governor’s 5 phase plan to reopen Illinois, we have a stronger view of the type of school interactions that will be permissible during the next few months. As it looks that the social restrictions in July will not be drastically different from now, we have had to reconsider our planned events. Consequently, we regret to announce that the HJHS 8th grade dance and the high school junior/senior prom scheduled for July are canceled. In addition, the HHS graduation has been moved up and will now take place on May 29, 2020. Details and procedures for the graduation ceremony will be announced on Tuesday May 19. We thank you for your patience and understanding as we adjust to the changing conditions of this unusual time.

European Capitals Trip

A 9-day European Capitals trip to London, Paris, and Rome is being planned for July 2021. This is for any student attending high school during the ‘20-‘21 school year. Amanda Cunningham and Kristy Andrews are co-leading the trip. Initial interest meeting will take place during Flex time on Thursday, February 13. Students interested should attend to obtain additional information. An informational parent meeting will take place the following Tuesday at 7 PM at HHS. We are so excited to provide an opportunity for our students to travel abroad and experience the culture, history, and inspiration that can only come from the world beyond the classroom.

Mrs. Olroyd’s Algebra I classes made use of the new Multi-Purpose room (old Study Hall room) to complete a Math Lib activity! Students walked around the room solving Systems of Equations using the elimination method. They then had to find the correct coordinate which was paired with a word or phrase, creating a fun and entertaining story! The Multi-Purpose room was such a great space to utilize for this activity! Students had plenty of room to get up and move around, and they always enjoy having class in a different space!

The Freshmen Geometry classes completed the same activity today, but their task was to solve problems involving Similar Figures and Proportional Parts. Students really enjoy the Math Lib story when they finished!
